image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch found guilty [File photo].

props.synopsis: Before Bradley Murdoch was arrested for English backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance and the attempted kidnapping of Joanne Lees, the killer faced charges, of which he was acquitted, of raping a woman and her 12-year-old daughter in South Australia. WARNING: This story contains content that some readers may find upsetting.

title.children: Before the Falconio trial, Bradley John Murdoch was accused and acquitted of rape and abduction

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: The Lord Mayor wants to nearly double the population of the CBD and North Adelaide by 2036. The last time the city had close to 50,000 residents, it was lectured for having "slums".

title.children: Adelaide's plan to double its CBD population without 'destroying the city'

image.altText: A man with walking sticks on a snowy mountain.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hutchinson says a school scholarship "fundamentally changed his life". He is now trekking across the US to give underprivileged kids the same opportunity.

title.children: 'Scruffy' kid who became surgeon thanks to scholarship treks to fund more

image.altText: Adelaide AFL men's coach Matthew Nicks stands in the middle of a group of players speaking during a game.

props.synopsis: Adelaide coach Matthew Nicks pinpoints a key factor in his club's rise from 15th last year to top of the ladder, as the Crows beat the Hawks in a Friday night blockbuster.

title.children: Nicks talks trust as Rankine, Walker star in Crows win over Hawks

image.altText: Two police officers lift police tape on the side of a hill, while they lead a dog on a leash underneath it.

props.synopsis: Several items related to the alleged murder of a Port Lincoln man have been located, a day after a civilian walking their dog found what is believed to be part of his remains.  Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Further evidence related to alleged Port Lincoln murder found

image.altText: Close up of Richard Boyle's face looking serious outdoors

props.synopsis: Australian Tax Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has argued he should be spared convictions because he was motivated by public interest, and his actions led to change within the federal agency.

title.children: Prosecutor says ATO whistleblower acted unlawfully

image.altText: A man makes a snow angle by lying on the ground and waving his arms and legs in a blanket of hail.

props.synopsis: A massive hailstorm transforms parts of far north South Australia into a scene from a European winter, which locals say "really did feel like snow".

title.children: Outback opal miners make 'snow angels' as hail blankets the desert

image.altText: A man in a dark hoodie, glasses and face mask walks next to two men in business suits outside the court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard Sumit Satish Rastogi, an unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women, is a "monster" and a "disgusting human being" whose offending left a huge impact on his victims.

title.children: Massage therapist who abused more than 60 women hears impact on victims

image.altText: Greyhound legs and lower torso while the animal is running.

props.synopsis: An independent inspector monitoring major reforms into South Australia's greyhound industry says half of the recommendations of an inquiry are underway, but more work still need to be done.

title.children: Nearly half of SA's greyhound racing reforms imposed, but more work required

image.altText: A 19th century single story manor house with a sign reading Ayers House in foreground

props.synopsis: Volunteer-run branches of the conservation charity, responsible for maintaining some of SA's most well-known landmarks, protest a new "service fee" on their earnings.

title.children: Leaked emails reveal National Trust's financial dispute with SA volunteers

image.altText: Close up of someone holding a Nokia 3310 with "Should you use a 'dumphone'?" on the screen.

props.synopsis: A study finds that receiving a smartphone before age 13 is associated with poorer mental health in young adulthood, as some teens turn to "dumbphones" instead.

title.children: Smartphones affect young people's mental health. Are dumbphones the answer?

image.altText: A close up of a phone against a woman's ear.

props.synopsis: About 20 per cent of calls to South Australia's domestic violence crisis line are going unanswered, despite a recent boost in government funding to address demand, the state's peak body for domestic violence services says.

title.children: One in five calls to SA DV crisis line goes unanswered despite extra funding

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a wide-brimmed hat and no tie, speaks behind a microphone.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is outlining Labor's Indigenous policy focus in his fourth address to the Garma Festival as prime minister. Follow live.

title.children: PM unveils plan for 'long-term prosperity' in Indigenous communities

image.altText: A group of children, dressed in black, stand with their arms in the air, surrounded by water mist.

props.synopsis: As the atrocities in Gaza continue, another crisis is enveloping the Middle East — as record heat, drought and wildfires open up another devastating front.

title.children: Ravaged after a 12-day war with Israel, Iran is now closing in on 'day zero'

image.altText: A close up of Donald Trump's face as he looks over his shoulder with a casual expression.

props.synopsis: The US president says nuclear submarines are being repositioned in response to "provocative statements" from Russia's former president, Dmitry Medvedev.

title.children: Trump says he's moving nuclear subs in response to Russian ex-president

image.altText: Education stock image

props.synopsis: When our parliaments, newsrooms, judicial benches and many other institutions all look a certain way, it is clear who is at the centre of Australia's monoculture.

title.children: The cracks are showing in the stories Australia tells itself about multiculturalism

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit stares off camera.

props.synopsis: The final seat of Bass has been decided, two weeks after the Tasmanian state election — with the winner a veteran physician who is staunchly opposed to the proposed Hobart AFL stadium.

title.children: Independent opponent to Hobart stadium wins final Tasmanian seat

image.altText: Two 20-something women and a middle-aged man hold up a clapper board that says 'Optics'

props.synopsis: We don't want to brag but the ABC has received 44 Logie nominations this year. From deep-dive documentaries to side-splitting comedies, it would be selfish of us not to share these ABC gems for your viewing pleasure.

title.children: From big laughs to bold stories, the ABC's Logie-nominated shows are ready to binge

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell faces second week in court

props.synopsis: Ghislaine Maxwell has been transferred to a lower-security prison in Texas to continue serving her 20-year prison sentence for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: Ghislaine Maxwell moved from Florida prison to lower-security facility

image.altText: The president of the United States stands at a microphone and points a finger

props.synopsis: The outcome somewhat took the wind out of the sails of those who have been criticising Australia's prime minister for not getting a meeting with the US president.

title.children: Trump's tariff turmoil highlights the influence of non-trade factors

image.altText: A crowd of people stand around a man in a suit sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting announces it will cease operations in a massive blow to the public media network in the United States.

title.children: Major public broadcasting group to close after Trump-led funding cuts

image.altText: Tesla Model S electric car

props.synopsis: Jurors awarded the estate of Naibel Benavides Leon and her former boyfriend, Dillon Angulo, $US129 million in compensatory damages, plus $US200 million in punitive damages.

title.children: Tesla ordered to pay $375 million in fatal autopilot crash

image.altText: Three women pose with medals after a swimming race

props.synopsis: Mollie O'Callaghan has come within 0.12 seconds of becoming Australia's most successful World Championships swimmer of all time, claiming silver in the women's 100m freestyle in Singapore.

title.children: Mollie O'Callaghan falls agonisingly short of record-breaking gold

image.altText: A person wearing blue gloves injects something on a microscope

props.synopsis: The baby boy's father was a toddler when his son's embryo was first created, in an event family members likened to "something from a sci-fi movie".

title.children: Baby born in US from an over‑30‑year‑old embryo breaks record

image.altText: American tennis player Jessica Pegula looks dejected after losing a point in a tournament.

props.synopsis: The Canadian Open draw opens up with the shock loss of two-time defending champion Jessica Pegula to the world's 386th-ranked player from Latvia.

title.children: Canadian Open champion Jessica Pegula beaten by world number 386 in Montreal

image.altText: A female student is surrounded by 3 firefighters, one of whom is holding a birthday cake with a lit candle number 22.

props.synopsis: In Indonesia, firefighters do not just battle flames — they pick up school report cards, banish ghosts, and comfort the broken-hearted. But these acts of public service throw a spotlight on other problems.

title.children: Who you gonna call? In Indonesia, firefighters tackle ghosts and broken hearts

image.altText: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, dressed in a suit, walking with a group

props.synopsis: South Korea's jailed former president, Yoon Suk Yeol, again refuses to attend questioning by investigators, using a new method to resist — taking off his prison uniform and lying down on the floor at his detention room.

title.children: South Korea's ex-president Yoon resists questioning by taking off prison uniform

image.altText: A family of three. The mum holds a black poodle and the son holds a football.

props.synopsis: After three successful organ transplants, the Stolkers say they've been given a new lease on life. Now they're campaigning for more Australians to become donors.

title.children: Organ transplants give family the 'gift of life' three times

image.altText: A bone and statuette at a shrine in the Tuam graveyard in Ireland

props.synopsis: Two boys found "a jumble of bones", which sparked the discovery and now excavation of a mass grave at a mother-and-baby home run by Catholic nuns.

title.children: Mass graveyard of 800 children being excavated in Ireland

image.altText: A shadowed woman standing in the foreground, the ATO website in the background

props.synopsis: Financial counsellors are calling on the tax office to give small businesses and individuals more time to pay tax debts, as the level of money owed sees calls to debt helplines hit unprecedented levels.

title.children: ATO denies 'heavy-handed' tax debt collection as concerns raised

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: The entry sign of James Cook University

props.synopsis: James Cook University faces pressure to take disciplinary action against a medical student sentenced for domestic violence assault.

title.children: Uni urged to take action after med student sentenced for DV assault

image.altText: On stage, Hazem Shammas, Arab Australian, 50, and Anthony Taufa, Tongan Australian, early 40s, look concerned in army fatigues.

props.synopsis: Shakespeare's Coriolanus has drawn parallels to Trump. But for its star Hazem Shammas, it has brought up the failures of the arts community in relation to the war in Gaza.

title.children: Artists are silenced for speaking out about Gaza, says Bell Shakespeare star
